file_content.text: Sir: I've double-checked my scores on the Post-Injury Proficiency Battery, and I can report that I'm fit to return to duty immediately.
Havoc will be in much better shape with you back in action.
Glad to hear it.
You were hit pretty bad, Elara. Don't push yourself.
Are you sure?
I take pride in pushing myself. And I assure you, there's no medical cause for me to take any more leave.
I'll be ready when you need me.
If you're fit for duty, then hop to it, soldier!
Then get to work!
Ahem. Yes, sir.
How are you doing, Elara?
Quite well. The injuries were serious, but Jorgan and the others performed admirable first aid.
I'm confident I'll return to duty soon. I certainly won't require the full allotment of medical leave assigned to me.
Take good care of yourself and let me know when you're patched up.
Very good.
I will, sir. Thank you.
Take your time and make sure you're one hundred percent, all right?
Don't push yourself too hard.
You shouldn't worry so much. I'll be fine.
No need to worry, sir. I'll ensure that I pass all required post-injury proficiency tests before resuming duty.
Thank you for stopping by.
I want you back in the field as soon as you can shoot straight, understood?
Get back to work ASAP.
Understood, sir. I won't keep you waiting.
